# Cosmic Pilgrimage
## Scripture
"And God said, 'Let there be lights in the vault of the sky to separate the day from the night, and let them serve as signs to mark sacred times, and days and years.'" - Genesis 1:14

## Reflection
As we gaze upon the night sky, we are reminded of the celestial bodies that mark the passage of time. The phases of the moon, the rotation of the planets, and the twinkling of the stars all serve as signs to guide us through the journey of life. Just as the ancient Israelites used the lunar cycles to mark sacred times and festivals, we too can find rhythm and purpose in the rhythms of the universe. Our lives are not just a random collection of moments, but a deliberate pilgrimage towards a greater purpose. As we navigate the ups and downs of life, we can look to the heavens for guidance, comfort, and hope.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we ponder the vast expanse of your creation, we are reminded of the sacred journey we are on. Help us to find our place in the grand tapestry of time, and to mark the sacred moments in our lives with gratitude and worship. May the celestial bodies serve as signs of your love and guidance, illuminating our path and filling us with wonder and awe. As we pilgrimage through life, may we fix our eyes on the heavenly lights that shine brightly in the darkness, leading us towards your eternal purpose.
